Berlin.title: Berlin
Berlin.description: Berlin is the capital and largest city of Germany, both by area and by population.

Berlin.title: Mitte (locality)
Berlin.description: Mitte (German pronunciation: [ˈmɪtə] ) (German for "middle" or "center") is a central section (Ortsteil) of Berlin, Germany, in the eponymous borough (Bezirk) of Mitte.

Berlin.title: Rotes Rathaus
Berlin.description: The Rotes Rathaus (German: [ˈʁoːtəs ˈʁaːtˌhaʊs] , Red City Hall) is the town hall of Berlin, Germany, located in the Mitte district on Rathausstraße near Alexanderplatz.

Berlin.title: Berlin Cathedral
Berlin.description: Berlin Cathedral (German: Berliner Dom), also known as the Evangelical Supreme Parish and Collegiate Church, is a monumental German Protestant  church and dynastic tomb (House of Hohenzollern) on the Museum Island in central Berlin.

Berlin.title: Cölln
Berlin.description: Cölln (German: [ˈkœln]) was the twin city of Old Berlin (Altberlin) from the 13th century to the 18th century.

Berlin.title: Berlin Hackescher Markt station
Berlin.description: Berlin Hackescher Markt is a railway station in the Mitte district of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Nikolaiviertel
Berlin.description: The Nikolaiviertel (; 'Nicholas Quarter') is an old quarter of the German capital of Berlin, founded c.

Berlin.title: Neues Museum
Berlin.description: The Neues Museum (New Museum) is a listed building on the Museum Island in the historic centre of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: North German Confederation
Berlin.description: The North German Confederation (German: ) was initially a German military alliance established in August 1866 under the leadership of the Kingdom of Prussia, which was transformed in the subsequent year into a confederated state (a de facto federal state) that existed from July 1867 to December 1870.

Berlin.title: Brandenburg-Prussia
Berlin.description: Brandenburg-Prussia (German: Brandenburg-Preußen; Low German: Brannenborg-Preußen) is the historiographic denomination for the early modern realm of the Brandenburgian Hohenzollerns between 1618 and 1701.

Berlin.title: Berlin Central and Regional Library
Berlin.description: The Berlin Central and Regional Library (German: Zentral- und Landesbibliothek Berlin) or ZLB is the official library of the City and State of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Sam'al lions
Berlin.description: The Sam'al lions are a number of lion-shaped statues from Sam'al, the modern Zincirli, which are currently located in the Vorderasiatisches Museum Berlin (Pergamon Museum), the Museum of the Ancient Orient (Istanbul) and the Louvre.

Berlin.title: Pergamon Museum
Berlin.description: The Pergamon Museum (German: Pergamonmuseum; pronounced [ˈpɛʁ.

Berlin.title: Museum Island
Berlin.description: The Museum Island (German: Museumsinsel) is a museum complex on the northern part of the Spree Island in the historic heart of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Maxim Gorki Theater
Berlin.description: The Maxim Gorki Theatre (German: Maxim Gorki Theater) is a theatre in Berlin-Mitte named after the Soviet writer Maxim Gorky.

Berlin.title: Bode Museum
Berlin.description: The Bode Museum, formerly called the Kaiser-Friedrich-Museum (Emperor Frederick Museum), is a listed building on the Museum Island in the historic centre of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Spandauer Vorstadt
Berlin.description: Spandauer Vorstadt ("Spandauer suburb", formerly also called Spandauer Quarter or Spandauer Viertel) is a historic district in what is now the Mitte district of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Scheunenviertel
Berlin.description: (German: "Barn Quarter") is a neighborhood of Mitte in the centre of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Germania (city)
Berlin.description: Welthauptstadt Germania (pronounced [ɡɛʁˈmaːni̯a]) or World Capital Germania was the projected renewal of the German capital Berlin during the Nazi period, part of Adolf Hitler's vision for the future of Nazi Germany after the planned victory in World War II.

Berlin.title: KitKatClub
Berlin.description: The KitKatClub is a nightclub in Berlin, opened in March 1994 by Austrian pornographic filmmaker Simon Thaur and his life partner Kirsten Krüger.

Berlin.title: Bundesdruckerei
Berlin.description: Bundesdruckerei (lit.

Berlin.title: Dorotheenstadt
Berlin.description: is a historic zone or neighbourhood (Stadtviertel) of central Berlin, Germany, which forms part of the locality (Ortsteil) of Mitte within the borough (Bezirk) also called Mitte.

Berlin.title: Prussian Staff College
Berlin.description: The Prussian Staff College, also Prussian War College (German: Preußische Kriegsakademie) was the highest military facility of the Kingdom of Prussia to educate, train, and develop general staff officers.

Berlin.title: Checkpoint Charlie
Berlin.description: Checkpoint Charlie (or "Checkpoint C") was the best-known Berlin Wall crossing point between East Berlin and West Berlin during the Cold War (1947–1991), as named by the Western Allies.

Berlin.title: Palace of the Reich President
Berlin.description: The Reich President's Palace (German: Reichspräsidentenpalais) was from 1919 to 1934 an official residence of the President of the Reich and the official seat of the German head of state.

Berlin.title: Hotel Adlon
Berlin.description: The Hotel Adlon Kempinski Berlin is a luxury hotel in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Führerbunker
Berlin.description: The Führerbunker (German pronunciation: [ˈfyːʁɐˌbʊŋkɐ] ) was an air raid shelter located near the Reich Chancellery in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Congress of Berlin
Berlin.description: The Congress of Berlin (13 June – 13 July 1878) was a diplomatic conference to reorganise the states in the Balkan Peninsula after the Russo-Turkish War (1877–1878), which had been won by Russia against the Ottoman Empire.

Berlin.title: Reich Ministry of Transport
Berlin.description: The Reich Ministry of Transport (German: Reichsverkehrsministerium, RVM) was a cabinet-level agency of the German government from 1919 until 1945, operating during the Weimar Republic and Nazi Germany.

Berlin.title: Charité
Berlin.description: The Charité – Universitätsmedizin Berlin (Charité – Berlin University Medicine) is Europe's largest university hospital, affiliated with Humboldt University and the Free University of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Berlin-Copenhagen Cycle Route
Berlin.description: The Berlin–Copenhagen Cycle Route (German: Radfernweg Berlin-Kopenhagen) is a 650 km (400 mi) long-distance cycling route that connects the German and Danish capital cities.

Berlin.title: Brandenburg Gate
Berlin.description: The Brandenburg Gate (German: Brandenburger Tor [ˈbʁandn̩ˌbʊʁɡɐ ˈtoːɐ̯] ) is an 18th-century neoclassical monument in Berlin.

Berlin.title: German Empire
Berlin.description: The German Empire (German: Deutsches Reich), also referred to as Imperial Germany, the Second Reich or simply Germany, was the period of the German Reich from the unification of Germany in 1871 until the November Revolution in 1918, when the German Reich changed its form of government from a monarchy to a republic.

Berlin.title: Battle of Berlin
Berlin.description: The Battle of Berlin, designated as the Berlin Strategic Offensive Operation by the Soviet Union, and also known as the Fall of Berlin, was one of the last major offensives of the European theatre of World War II.

Berlin.title: Bernauer Straße
Berlin.description: Bernauer Straße is a street of Berlin situated between the localities of Gesundbrunnen and Mitte, today both belonging to the Mitte borough.

Berlin.title: Weimar Republic
Berlin.description: The Weimar Republic, officially known as the German Reich, was a historical period of Germany from 9 November 1918 to 23 March 1933, during which it was a constitutional federal republic for the first time in history; hence it is also referred to, and unofficially proclaimed itself, as the German Republic.

Berlin.title: Mall of Berlin
Berlin.description: The LP12 Mall of Berlin, also known as Leipziger Platz Quartier or simply Mall of Berlin, is a shopping mall in the Mitte borough of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Natural History Museum, Berlin
Berlin.description: The Natural History Museum (German: Museum für Naturkunde) is a natural history museum located in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Schutzstaffel
Berlin.description: The Schutzstaffel (SS; also stylised as ᛋᛋ with Armanen runes; German pronunciation: [ˈʃʊtsˌʃtafl̩] ; lit.

Berlin.title: Federal Ministry for Digital and Transport
Berlin.description: The Federal Ministry for Digital and Transport (German: Bundesministerium für Digitales und Verkehr, pronounced [ˈbʊndəsminɪsˌteːʁiʊm fyːɐ̯ diɡiˈtaːləs ʊnt fɛɐ̯ˈkeːɐ̯] ), abbreviated BMDV, is a cabinet-level ministry of the Federal Republic of Germany.

Berlin.title: Volkshalle
Berlin.description: The Volkshalle ("People's Hall"), also called Große Halle ("Great Hall") or Ruhmeshalle ("Hall of Glory"), was a proposal for a monumental, domed building to be built in a reconstituted Berlin (renamed as Germania) in Nazi Germany.

Berlin.title: Grand Hotel Bellevue (Berlin)
Berlin.description: The Grand Hotel Bellevue was a hotel on the Potsdamer Platz in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Nazi Germany
Berlin.description: Nazi Germany, officially known as the German Reich and later the Greater German Reich, is a term used to describe the German state between 1933 and 1945, when Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party controlled the country, transforming it into a totalitarian dictatorship.

Berlin.title: Sony Center
Berlin.description: The Center Potsdamer Platz, known as Sony Center until March 2023, is a complex of eight buildings located at the Potsdamer Platz in Berlin, Germany, designed by Helmut Jahn.

Berlin.title: Federal Chancellery, Berlin
Berlin.description: The Federal Chancellery (German: Bundeskanzleramt, pronounced [ˈbʊndəskant͡slɐˌʔamt͡] ) in Berlin is the official seat and residence of the chancellor of Germany as well as their executive office, the German Chancellery.

Berlin.title: Headquarters of the Federal Intelligence Service
Berlin.description: The Headquarters of the Federal Intelligence Service or the BND Headquarters (German: Zentrale des Bundesnachrichtendienstes, colloquially the BND-Zentrale) is the headquarters of the Federal Intelligence Service (BND) of Germany, and is located at the Chausseestraße in the Mitte district in the centre of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Prenzlauer Berg
Berlin.description: Prenzlauer Berg (German pronunciation: [ˌpʁɛnt͡slaʊ̯ɐ ˈbɛʁk] ) is a locality of Berlin, forming the southerly and most urban district of the borough of Pankow.

Berlin.title: Mehringplatz
Berlin.description: Mehringplatz is a round plaza (or circus) at the southern tip of the Friedrichstadt neighborhood of Kreuzberg district, Berlin.

Berlin.title: Berliner Philharmonie
Berlin.description: The Berliner Philharmonie (German: [bɛʁˌliːnɐ fɪlhaʁmoˈniː] ) is a concert hall in Berlin, Germany, and home to the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra.

Berlin.title: Mitte
Berlin.description: Mitte (German: [ˈmɪtə] ) is the first and most central borough of Berlin.

Berlin.title: Invalids' Cemetery
Berlin.description: The Invalids' Cemetery (German: Invalidenfriedhof) is one of the oldest cemeteries in Berlin.

Berlin.title: Haus der Kulturen der Welt
Berlin.description: The Haus der Kulturen der Welt (HKW), in English House of World Cultures, in Berlin is Germany's national center for the presentation and discussion of international contemporary arts, with a special focus on non-European cultures and societies.

Berlin.title: Kulturforum
Berlin.description: The Kulturforum (English: Cultural Forum) is a collection of cultural buildings in Berlin.

Berlin.title: Berghain
Berlin.description: Berghain (German: [bɛɐ̯khaɪn]) is a nightclub in Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.description: Bernauer Straße is a street of Berlin situated between the localities of Gesundbrunnen and Mitte, today both belonging to the Mitte borough.

Berlin.title: Jewish Orphanage Berlin-Pankow
Berlin.description: Jewish Orphanage Berlin-Pankow (German: Jüdisches Waisenhaus) is a former Jewish orphanage and a listed building in Berlin-Pankow.

Berlin.title: Nazi Germany
Berlin.description: Nazi Germany, officially known as the German Reich and later the Greater German Reich, is a term used to describe the German state between 1933 and 1945, when Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party controlled the country, transforming it into a totalitarian dictatorship.

Berlin.title: Velodrom (Berlin)
Berlin.description: The Velodrom (velodrome) is an indoor track cycling arena, in the Prenzlauer Berg locality of Berlin, Germany.

Berlin.title: Federal Chancellery, Berlin
Berlin.description: The Federal Chancellery (German: Bundeskanzleramt, pronounced [ˈbʊndəskant͡slɐˌʔamt͡] ) in Berlin is the official seat and residence of the chancellor of Germany as well as their executive office, the German Chancellery.

Berlin.title: Reich Chancellery
Berlin.description: The Reich Chancellery (German: Reichskanzlei) was the traditional name of the office of the Chancellor of Germany (then called Reichskanzler) in the period of the German Reich from 1878 to 1945.

Berlin.title: Federal Ministry of the Interior (Germany)
Berlin.description: The Federal Ministry of the Interior and Community (German: Bundesministerium des Innern und für Heimat, German pronunciation: [ˈbʊndəsminɪsˌteːʁiʊm dɛs ˈɪnəʁn ʊnt fyːɐ̯ ˈhaɪ̯maːt] , abbreviated BMI, is a cabinet-level ministry of the Federal Republic of Germany.

Stockholm.title: Battle of Brunkeberg
Stockholm.description: The Battle of Brunkeberg was fought on 10 October 1471 between the Swedish regent Sten Sture the Elder and forces led by Danish king Christian I.

Stockholm.title: Royal Swedish Opera
Stockholm.description: Royal Swedish Opera (Swedish: Kungliga Operan) is an opera and ballet company based in Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Helgeandsholmen
Stockholm.description: Helgeandsholmen (Swedish: [ˈhêːlɡɛandsˌhɔlːmɛn]) is a small island in central Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Rosenbad
Stockholm.description: Rosenbad (Swedish: [ˈrûːsɛnˌbɑːd], lit.

Stockholm.title: Riksdag
Stockholm.description: The Riksdag (Swedish: [ˈrɪ̌ksdɑː(ɡ)] , lit.

Stockholm.title: Parliament House, Stockholm
Stockholm.description: The Parliament House (Swedish: Riksdagshuset [ˈrɪ̂ksdɑː(ɡ)sˌhʉːsɛt] ) is the seat of the parliament of Sweden, the Riksdag.

Stockholm.title: Bankkajen
Stockholm.description: Bankkajen (Swedish: The Bank Quay) is a quay and a street passing along the western shore of the islet Helgeandsholmen in Gamla stan, the old town in central Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Prästgatan
Stockholm.description: Prästgatan (Swedish: "The Priest's Street") is a street in Gamla stan, the old town in central Stockholm, Sweden, stretching from a cul-de-sac west of the Royal Palace to the street Österlånggatan in the southern corner of the old town.

Stockholm.title: Mynttorget
Stockholm.description: Mynttorget (Swedish: [ˈmʏ̂ntˌtɔrjɛt], "the Coin Square") is a public square in Gamla stan, the old town in central Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Tre Kronor (castle)
Stockholm.description: Tre Kronor (Swedish pronunciation: [ˈtreː ˈkrûːnʊr]) or Three Crowns Castle was a castle located in Stockholm, Sweden, on the site where Stockholm Palace is today.

Stockholm.title: Brantingtorget
Stockholm.description: Brantingtorget (Swedish: "Square of Branting") is the courtyard of  the  Chancery House annex (Kanslihusannexet), acting as one of the public squares in Gamla stan, the old town in central Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Regalia of Sweden
Stockholm.description: Sweden's regalia are kept deep in the vaults of the Royal Treasury (Swedish: Skattkammaren), underneath the Royal Palace in Stockholm, in a museum that is open to the public.

Stockholm.title: Grand Hôtel (Stockholm)
Stockholm.description: Grand Hôtel is a five-star hotel in Stockholm.

Stockholm.title: Klara Church
Stockholm.description: The Church of Saint Clare or Klara Church (Swedish: Klara kyrka) is a church in central Stockholm.

Stockholm.title: Swedish Theatre (Stockholm)
Stockholm.description: The Swedish Theatre (Swedish: Svenska Teatern or "Svenskan") in Stockholm was, at the beginning of the 20th century, Sweden's largest dramatic theatre.

Stockholm.title: T-Centralen
Stockholm.description: T-Centralen (Swedish for "The T-Central"; T being an abbreviation for "tunnelbana", the Swedish word for "underground"  or "subway") is a metro station that forms the heart of the Stockholm metro system, in the sense that it is the only station where all three of the system's lines meet.

Stockholm.title: Stadsholmen
Stockholm.description: Stadsholmen is the historical name of an island in the centre of Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: 2017 Stockholm truck attack
Stockholm.description: On 7 April 2017, a vehicle-ramming Islamist terrorist attack took place in central Stockholm, the capital of Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Norrmalmstorg robbery
Stockholm.description: The Norrmalmstorg robbery was a bank robbery and hostage crisis that occurred at the Norrmalmstorg Square in Stockholm, Sweden, in August 1973 and was the first crime in Sweden to be covered by live television.

Stockholm.title: Greyfriars Monastery, Stockholm
Stockholm.description: The Greyfriars Monastery (Swedish: Gråmunkeklostret) on the island of Riddarholmen in Stockholm was a monastery for males of the Franciscan Order, in operation from 1270 until the Swedish Reformation of 1527.

Stockholm.title: Riddarholmen Church
Stockholm.description: Riddarholmen Church (Swedish: Riddarholmskyrkan) is the church of the former medieval Greyfriars Monastery in Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Nybroplan
Stockholm.description: Nybroplan (Swedish for "New Bridge square") is a public space in central Stockholm, Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Royal Dramatic Theatre
Stockholm.description: The Royal Dramatic Theatre (Swedish: Kungliga Dramatiska Teatern, colloquially Dramaten) is Sweden's national stage for "spoken drama", founded in 1788.

Stockholm.title: Karlaplan metro station
Stockholm.description: Karlaplan metro station is a station on the red line of the Stockholm metro, located at Karlaplan in the district of Östermalm.

Stockholm.title: Hötorget metro station
Stockholm.description: Hötorget, formerly known as Kungsgatan, is an underground station on the Green line of the Stockholm metro.

Stockholm.title: 2017 Stockholm truck attack
Stockholm.description: On 7 April 2017, a vehicle-ramming Islamist terrorist attack took place in central Stockholm, the capital of Sweden.

Stockholm.title: Klara Church
Stockholm.description: The Church of Saint Clare or Klara Church (Swedish: Klara kyrka) is a church in central Stockholm.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda County
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda County (Lithuanian: Klaipėdos apskritis) is one of ten counties in Lithuania, bordering Tauragė County to the southeast, Telšiai County to the northeast, Kurzeme in Latvia to the north, and Kaliningrad Oblast in Russia to the south.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Castle
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda Castle, also known as Memelburg or Memel Castle, is an archeological site and museum housed in a castle built by the Teutonic Knights in Klaipėda, Lithuania, near the Baltic Sea.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda
Klaipeda.description: Klaipėda ( CLAY-ped-ə; Lithuanian: [ˈkɫɐɪpʲeːdɐ] ; German: Memel) is a city in Lithuania on the Baltic Sea coast.

Klaipeda.title: Klaipėda Revolt
Klaipeda.description: The Klaipėda Revolt took place in January 1923 in the Klaipėda Region (also known as the Memel Territory or Memelland).

Klaipeda.title: Švyturys Arena
Klaipeda.description: Švyturio Arena (English: Lighthouse Arena) is an indoor arena in Klaipėda, Lithuania.

Tokyo.title: Greater Tokyo Area
Tokyo.description: The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world, consisting of the Kantō region of Japan (including Tokyo Metropolis and the prefectures of Chiba, Gunma, Ibaraki, Kanagawa, Saitama, and Tochigi) as well as the prefecture of Yamanashi of the neighboring Chūbu region.

Tokyo.title: Tokyo
Tokyo.description: Tokyo (; Japanese: 東京, Tōkyō, [toːkʲoː] ), officially the Tokyo Metropolis (東京都, Tōkyō-to), is the capital city of Japan and one of the most populous cities in the world, with a population of over 14 million residents as of 2023.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku Face
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku Face (新宿FACE, Shinjuku feisu) is an event hall located on the 7th floor of the Humax Pavilion Shinjuku complex, 1-20-1 Kabukicho, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Kabukichō
Tokyo.description: Kabukichō (Japanese: 歌舞伎町, pronounced [kabɯki̥ tɕoː]) is an entertainment district in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Shinjuku
Tokyo.description: Shinjuku (Japanese: 新宿区, Hepburn: Shinjuku-ku, IPA: [ɕiɲdʑɯkɯ] ), officially called Shinjuku City, is a special ward of Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: United Nations University
Tokyo.description: The United Nations University (国際連合大学, Kokusai Rengō Daigaku) (UNU) is the think tank and academic arm of the United Nations.

Tokyo.title: Shibuya Crossing
Tokyo.description: Shibuya Scramble Crossing (渋谷スクランブル交差点, Shibuya sukuranburu kōsaten), commonly known as Shibuya Crossing, is a popular pedestrian scramble crossing in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan.

Tokyo.title: Ebisu, Shibuya
Tokyo.description: Ebisu (恵比寿) is the southernmost part of Shibuya ward in Tokyo, Japan, and a major district of the ward.

Tokyo.title: Otome Road
Tokyo.description: Otome Road (乙女ロード, Otome Rōdo, lit.

Tokyo.title: Gakushūin
Tokyo.description: The Gakushūin (学習院), or Gakushuin School Corporation (学校法人学習院), historically known as the Peers' School, is a Japanese educational institution in Tokyo, originally established as Gakushūjo (学習所) to educate the children of Japan's nobility.

Tokyo.title: Otome Road
Tokyo.description: Otome Road (乙女ロード, Otome Rōdo, lit.

Tokyo.title: Bombing of Tokyo
Tokyo.description: The Bombing of Tokyo (東京大空襲, Tōkyōdaikūshū) was a series of bombing air raids launched by the United States Army Air Forces during World War II.
